metadata.title: Friday, 25th October, 2013
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a)when permanent police presence will be re-established in Garden Compound in Lusaka;
(b)how much money is required to build a police station in the area; and
(c)what steps have been taken to combat the high crime rate in the area.

questions.minister: Vice President whether the Government has any plans of creating a new district in Lwela area of Senior Chief Milambo in Chembe Parliamentary Constituency.

parts: (a)how much money has been spent on the Constitution making process to-date; and

(b)how much is the total estimated cost to be spent up to the completion of the process. QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN ANSWER W5    Mr Katuka (Mwinilunga) - to the Minister of Commerce, Trade and Industry how many people in the North-Western Province benefited from the Citizens Economic Empowerment Commission funds from 2011 to 2012, district by district. W6    Mr Chipungu (Rufunsa) - to ask the Minister of Agriculture and Livestock:
(a)when the Government last conducted a livestock census country-wide for the following types of animals and poultry:
(b)what the total population for the livestock at (a) was as of 31st December, 2012;
(c)when the Government plans to conduct another livestock census;
(d)what the population of the livestock at (a) was in Rufunsa District as of 31st December, 2012; and
(e)what measures the Government has taken to increase the population of livestock in Rufunsa District. ORDER OF THE DAY 1    Supply - Motion (11th October) - Resumption of Debate.
